edu.stanford.nlp.parser.lexparser

Class TregexPoweredTreebankParserParams

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.nlp.parser.lexparser.AbstractTreebankParserParams
      • edu.stanford.nlp.parser.lexparser.TregexPoweredTreebankParserParams
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TreebankLangParserParams, TreebankFactory, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FrenchTreebankParserParams, SpanishTreebankParserParams

    public abstract class TregexPoweredTreebankParserParams
extends AbstractTreebankParserParams
    An extension of AbstractTreebankParserParams which provides support for Tregex-powered annotations. Subclasses of this class provide collections of features which are associated with annotation behaviors that seek out and label matching trees in some way. For example, a coord feature might have an annotation behavior which searches for coordinating noun phrases and labels the associated constituent with a suffix -coordinating. The "search" in this process is conducted via Tregex, and the actual annotation is done through execution of an arbitrary Function provided by the user. This class carries as inner several classes several useful common annotation functions.
    Author:
    Jon Gauthier, Spence Green
    See Also:
    annotations, TregexPoweredTreebankParserParams.SimpleStringFunction, Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • annotations

        protected final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Pair<java.lang.String,java.util.function.Function<TregexMatcher,java.lang.String>>> annotations
        This data structure dictates how an arbitrary tree should be annotated. It is a collection of features: a map from feature name to behavior, where each behavior is a tuple (t, f). t is a string form of a TregexPattern which matches subtrees corresponding to the feature, and f is a function which accepts such matches and generates an annotation which the matched subtree should be given.
        See Also:
        annotationPatterns, TregexPoweredTreebankParserParams.SimpleStringFunction

      • compileAnnotations

        protected void compileAnnotations(HeadFinder hf)
        Compile the annotations collection given a particular head finder. Subclasses should call this method at least once before the class is used, and whenever the head finder is changed.

      • addFeature

        protected void addFeature(java.lang.String featureName)
        Enable an annotation feature. If the provided feature has already been enabled, this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        featureName -
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the provided feature name is unknown (i.e., if there is no entry in the annotations collection with the same name)

      • removeFeature

        protected void removeFeature(java.lang.String featureName)
        Disable a feature. If the feature was never enabled, this method returns without error.
        Parameters:
        featureName -

      • transformTree

        public Tree transformTree(Tree t,
                          Tree root)
        This method does language-specific tree transformations such as annotating particular nodes with language-relevant features. Such parameterizations should be inside the specific TreebankLangParserParams class. This method is recursively applied to each node in the tree (depth first, left-to-right), so you shouldn't write this method to apply recursively to tree members. This method is allowed to (and in some cases does) destructively change the input tree t. It changes both labels and the tree shape.
        Specified by:
        transformTree in interface TreebankLangParserParams
        Specified by:
        transformTree in class AbstractTreebankParserParams
        Parameters:
        t - The input tree (with non-language specific annotation already done, so you need to strip back to basic categories)
        root - The root of the current tree (can be null for words)
        Returns:
        The fully annotated tree node (with daughters still as you want them in the final result)

      • getAnnotationString

        protected java.lang.String getAnnotationString(Tree t,
                                               Tree root)
        Build a string of annotations for the given tree.
        Parameters:
        t - The input tree (with non-language specific annotation already done, so you need to strip back to basic categories)
        root - The root of the current tree (can be null for words)
        Returns:
        A (possibly empty) string of annotations to add to the given tree
